Preterit.turoyo: mtarásle-li ádyawma b-dukṯe d-ruḥe 159; 60/163;qayəmhanoMḥammaye Elo məḷḷe l-am=Mədwoyebaxtialxuṭr=oṯən u=săwāl-aṯxusīdan w-diḏanoṯənsīdayxumedebayn elan w-alxulaytmətyaqanneqayimimṭaraṣṣe u=săwāl-aṯṯe l-u=ḥdud d-bayn alle w-l- Mḥammaye Eloḥḥ
translations: Elo said to the inhabitants of
: “You have my word. Let your cattle come to us, and let ours come to you. There is nothing (bad) between you and us”. – And they believed him and sent their cattle to the border between them and
